title: If you need more AirTags, there’s never been a better time to buy
content:
Macworld

AirTags are Apple’s cheapest and most versatile device, offering cross-platform device tracking for under $30. And today you can get started for even less: Amazon is selling a four-pack of AirTags for $75, a savings of $25 and the best price we’ve ever seen.

AirTags are small white-and-chrome Bluetooth trackers that add Find My support to keys, wallets, and other non-Apple items. The small discs connect to the app like an iPhone or MacBook and alert you when something is lost, stolen, or left behind, and when something goes missing you can tap into the vast Find My network to find it. They’re small enough to fit anywhere, but you’ll need a separate AirTag holder if you want to attach it to a zipper or set of keys.

This deal brings the per-AirTag cost down to less than $19., so if you’re looking for a last-minute gift, go grab a pack before the price shoots back up.
